test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System continuously monitors temperature in all GMP storage areas as specified in URS-EMS-001.
prerequisites: System is installed and powered on

test_steps.action: Access the system's monitoring interface.
test_steps.expected_result: Interface displays real-time temperature readings for all GMP storage areas.

test_steps.action: Observe temperature readings for 15 minutes.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature readings are updated continuously at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.

acceptance_criteria: Readings are updated at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: To verify that the system generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint as specified in URS-EMS-005.
prerequisites: System is installed and powered on

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 20°C.
test_steps.expected_result: Setpoint is successfully configured.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation to 22°C.
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert indicating a temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: Alert is generated when temperature deviates ±2°C from setpoint
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System accurately measures temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the reference thermometer to a known temperature within the range.
test_steps.expected_result: Reference thermometer displays the set temperature.

test_steps.action: Compare the EMS temperature reading with the reference thermometer.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS temperature reading is within ±0.5°C of the reference thermometer.

acceptance_criteria: EMS temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of the reference thermometer
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are accurately recorded

test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS correctly integrates with the site paging system to send alarm notifications when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS detects the deviation and triggers an alarm.

test_steps.action: Check the site paging system for the alarm notification.
test_steps.expected_result: Alarm notification is received on the site paging system.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications are correctly sent to the site paging system
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alarm notifications are accurately recorded

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS correctly integrates with the site paging system to send alarm notifications when temperature deviations occur.
prerequisites: Site paging system is configured and operational

test_steps.action: Configure the EMS to send alarm notifications to the site paging system via the vendor API.
test_steps.expected_result: Configuration is saved successfully without errors.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation (±2°C from setpoint) using the test probe.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS detects the deviation and triggers an alarm.

test_steps.action: Verify that the alarm notification is received by the site paging system.
test_steps.expected_result: Paging system displays the alarm notification within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications are successfully sent to the paging system within 30 seconds of deviation.
All notifications include correct temperature deviation details.
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 for electronic records and signatures
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm logs must be complete and unaltered
Notification timestamps must match EMS logs

test_cases.objective: Ensure that the EMS correctly archives and retains data for the required 7-year period using the vendor's archival feature.
prerequisites: Test data is available for archival

test_steps.action: Generate test data in the EMS database (e.g., temperature readings, alarms).
test_steps.expected_result: Test data is successfully recorded in the database.

test_steps.action: Initiate the vendor's archival process for the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: Archival process completes without errors.

test_steps.action: Verify that the archived data is retrievable and intact after archival.
test_steps.expected_result: Archived data matches original test data with no corruption.

acceptance_criteria: Data is successfully archived without loss or corruption.
Archived data remains retrievable and intact for verification.
data_integrity_requirements: Archived data must be complete and unaltered
Retrieval process must maintain data integrity

test_cases.test_name: Integration Test: Alarm Notification with Paging System
test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS correctly integrates with the site paging system for alarm notifications using the vendor's API.
prerequisites: Site paging system configured and ready

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation exceeding ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS triggers an alarm condition.

test_steps.action: Verify that the alarm notification is sent to the site paging system.
test_steps.expected_result: Paging system receives and displays the alarm notification.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications are successfully sent to the paging system within 30 seconds of the alarm condition.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alarm notifications are logged and timestamped accurately.

test_cases.test_name: Performance Test: System Response Time for Alarm Conditions
test_cases.objective: To ensure the EMS responds to alarm conditions within the specified 30-second timeframe.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation exceeding ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS triggers an alarm condition.

test_steps.action: Measure the time taken from the alarm condition to the system response.
test_steps.expected_result: System response time does not exceed 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: System responds to alarm conditions within 30 seconds.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alarm responses are logged and timestamped accurately.

test_cases.test_name: Integration of Alarm Notifications with Site Paging System
test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS successfully integrates with the site paging system for alarm notifications using the vendor API.

test_steps.action: Configure the EMS to send alarm notifications via the vendor API.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS configuration is successfully completed.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation alarm in the EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Alarm notification is received by the site paging system.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications are successfully sent to the site paging system.
API integration is functioning as per vendor documentation.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alarm notifications are accurately logged and traceable.

test_cases.objective: To ensure that the EMS retains data for a minimum of 7 years using the vendor's archival feature.

test_steps.action: Access the EMS archival system and verify the oldest data record.
test_steps.expected_result: Oldest data record is at least 7 years old.

test_steps.action: Attempt to retrieve a data record from 7 years ago.
test_steps.expected_result: Data record is successfully retrieved and is accurate.

acceptance_criteria: Data is retained for a minimum of 7 years.
Archival system is functioning as per vendor specifications.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all archived data is complete, accurate, and retrievable.
